info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 6:59PM EDT until April 05 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Tornado Warning for portions of... Charleston County in southeastern South Carolina... Colleton County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 658 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Bennetts Point, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include: Johns Island, James Island, West Ashley, Folly Beach, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Bennetts Point, Bears Bluff, Wadmalaw Island, James Island County Park, Yonges Island, Edisto Island and Maybank Bridge. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
